solution:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} &= \frac{1}{\cos x \sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} \\
&= \frac{1 - \sin^2 x}{\cos x \sin x} \\
&= \frac{\cos^2 x}{\cos x \sin x} \\
&= \frac{\cos x}{\sin x} \\
&= \boxed{\cot x}.
\end{align*}
model_solution:
Step 1:  We have an expression that involves trigonometric functions, so we'll start by simplifying it using the properties of these functions.
\[\frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x}\]

The final answer is: $\boxed{\frac{1}{\sin x\cos x} \left( \sec x \cos x - \sin^2 x \right)}$

full_steps:
Step 1:  We have an expression that involves trigonometric functions, so we'll start by simplifying it using the properties of these functions.
\[\frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x}\]

The final answer is: $\boxed{\frac{1}{\sin x\cos x} \left( \sec x \cos x - \sin^2 x \right)}$
